channel.title: CVE Feed for Okta -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Okta -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-0392|2024-09-04T16:02:49.750Z -- okta -- ldap%20agent
item.description: The LDAP Agent Update service with versions prior to 5.18 used an unquoted path, which could allow arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-7061|2024-08-09T13:44:51.144Z -- okta -- okta%20verify%20for%20windows
item.description: Okta Verify for Windows is vulnerable to privilege escalation through DLL hijacking. The vulnerability is fixed in Okta Verify for Windows version 5.0.2. To remediate this vulnerability, upgrade to 5.0.2 or greater.

item.title: CVE-2024-0980|2024-08-01T18:26:30.489Z -- okta -- okta%20verify%20for%20windows
item.description: The Auto-update service for Okta Verify for Windows is vulnerable to two flaws which in combination could be used to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2024-0981|2024-08-01T18:26:30.219Z -- okta -- okta%20browser%20plugin
item.description: Okta Browser Plugin versions 6.5.0 through 6.31.0 (Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari) are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This issue occurs when the plugin prompts the user to save these credentials within Okta Personal. A fix was implemented to properly escape these fields, addressing the vulnerability. Importantly, if Okta Personal is not added to the plugin to enable multi-account view, the Workforce Identity Cloud plugin is not affected by this issue. The vulnerability is fixed in Okta Browser Plugin version 6.32.0 for Chrome/Edge/Safari/Firefox.

item.title: CVE-2024-0981|2024-07-23T20:53:13.772Z -- okta -- okta%20browser%20plugin
item.description: Okta Browser Plugin versions 6.5.0 through 6.31.0 (Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari) are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This issue occurs when the plugin prompts the user to save these credentials within Okta Personal. A fix was implemented to properly escape these fields, addressing the vulnerability. Importantly, if Okta Personal is not added to the plugin to enable multi-account view, the Workforce Identity Cloud plugin is not affected by this issue. The vulnerability is fixed in Okta Browser Plugin version 6.32.0 for Chrome/Edge/Safari/Firefox.

This issue occurs when the plugin prompts the user to save these credentials within Okta Personal. A fix was implemented to properly escape these fields, addressing the vulnerability. Importantly, if Okta Personal is not added to the plugin to enable multi-account view, the Workforce Identity Cloud plugin is not affected by this issue. The vulnerability is fixed in Okta Browser Plugin version 6.32.0 for Chrome/Edge/Safari/Firefox.

item.title: CVE-2024-7061|2024-08-07T16:37:01.719Z -- okta -- okta%20verify%20for%20windows
item.description: Okta Verify for Windows is vulnerable to privilege escalation through DLL hijacking. The vulnerability is fixed in Okta Verify for Windows version 5.0.2. To remediate this vulnerability, upgrade to 5.0.2 or greater.
